item.title: Anteater: The Plazi Newsletter
item.description: “Giant Anteater” by Petr Kratochvil released CCO Public Domain Dedication Anteater is a common name for the four extant mammal species of the suborder Vermilingua (meaning “worm tongue”) commonly known for eating ants and termites. The individual species have other names in English and other languages. Together with the sloths, they are within the order Pilosa. Wikipedia contributors. (2021, June 26). Anteater. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia.
